metadata.title: CVE-2015-5162 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The image parser in OpenStack Cinder 7.0.2 and 8.0.0 through 8.1.1; Glancebefore 11.0.1 and 12.0.0; and Nova before 12.0.4 and 13.0.0 does notproperly limit qemu-img calls, which might allow attackers to cause adenial of service (memory and disk consumption) via a crafted disk image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5162` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-api - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-api-metadata - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-api-os-compute - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-api-os-volume - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-cells - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-cert - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-common - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-kvm - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-lxc - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-qemu - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-vmware - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-compute-xen - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-conductor - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-console - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-consoleauth - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-network - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-novncproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-scheduler - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-serialproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-spiceproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-volume - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
python-nova - 2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:13.1.4-0ubuntu3').
